intro: Eritrichium cephalanthum, commonly known as the hoary erythronium, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
